name: Salmon Ceviche
author: Sarah Z
summary: Thin slices of salmon lounge in a citrus, cilantro and garlic marinade for four hours before being served with chips, rice or tortillas. Fresh ingredients are what makes this simple, easy dish amazing. The hardest part of it is the slicing and dicing. With minimal effort and no cooking you'll get rave reviews. This can just as easily pass for an appetizer in smaller portions.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon chili paste or sauce
¼ cup extra virgin olive oil
1 pound very fresh salmon fillets (sushi-grade preferred), thinly sliced
directions: In a large glass or plastic bowl, dissolve the sugar, salt, and chili paste in the lime juice
Stir in the olive oil, garlic, onion, tomato, and cilantro
Gently mix in the salmon, then cover, and refrigerate for 4 hours
To serve, drain the excess liquid from the salmon, then gently stir in the avocado slices, and allow to rest at room temperature for 15 minutes
